materials.raw_text: Hg: 100 g,  In: 50 g, Pr: 30 g, Sn: 150 g

sourcing.instructions: Hg: Specialized chemical suppliers or licensed hazardous material distributors; In: Electronics suppliers or metal dealers; Pr: Rare earth suppliers; Sn: Metal suppliers or hardware stores.
steps: Hg: Specialized chemical suppliers or licensed hazardous material distributors; In: Electronics suppliers or metal dealers; Pr: Rare earth suppliers; Sn: Metal suppliers or hardware stores.

1. Wear appropriate safety gear including gloves and goggles. 2. Measure 100 g of Hg using a digital scale. 3. Measure 50 g of In and add to a mixing container. 4. Measure 30 g of Pr and add to the same container. 5. Measure 150 g of Sn and add to the mixture. 6. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure even distribution of all elements.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Wear appropriate safety gear including gloves and goggles. 2. Measure 100 g of Hg using a digital scale. 3. Measure 50 g of In and add to a mixing container. 4. Measure 30 g of Pr and add to the same container. 5. Measure 150 g of Sn and add to the mixture. 6. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure even distribution of all elements.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a heat-resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace set to 800 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and alloying of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a heat-resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace set to 800 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and alloying of materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not disturb the crucible during this time to avoid defects.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not disturb the crucible during this time to avoid defects.

steps: 1. Remove the cooled solid from the crucible. 2. Use a file or sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to protect the surface from oxidation if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the cooled solid from the crucible. 2. Use a file or sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing coat to protect the surface from oxidation if necessary.
